list_definition.definition: the reddish-brown substance which forms on iron and steel, caused by air and moisture

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The car was covered with rust.

list_definition.definition: to (cause to) become covered with rust

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The rain has rusted the gate
There’s a lot of old metal rusting in the garden.

The iron bar that runs through the concrete slab is often rusted or rotten.
By this time many of the ship's plates were rusting and her entire water distribution system had to be dismantled for cleaning in 1909.
Due to rusting, few iron objects have survived from this period.
In 1926 when the miners went back to work they found that their shovels, hammers and picks had rotted and rusted.
Expert engineers cannot give an opinion as to when all the mines will be rusted and no longer dangerous.

In contrast to leaf rust, a highly specialized, wind-borne pathogen with a shallow dispersal gradient, tan spot is residue-borne with a steep dispersal gradient69.
